U.S."},"states":"\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesalabama-population-target_blankalabamaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/alabama-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAlabama\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe 2010 census concluded that the state of Alabama had a population of 4,785,448, which increased in the 2018 assessment by 2.36% to 4,887,871 people. The most recent estimates that Alabamaâs 2019 population has grown an additional 0.21% to 4,898,246 people. With this estimate, Alabama comprises approximately 1.47% of the entire US population.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlabamaâs population places it at the 24th most populated state in the \u003ca href='/countries/united-states-population/' target='_blank'\u003eUnited States\u003c/a\u003e with an above-average density of 97 people per square mile. \u003ca href='/us-cities/montgomery-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMontgomery\u003c/a\u003e, the state capital, has shown slow yet consistent growth in population and currently is home to approximately 205,000 people. However, the largest city in Alabama by population is \u003ca href='/us-cities/birmingham-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBirmingham\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesalaska-population-target_blankalaskaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/alaska-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAlaska\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlaska is a unique state due to its unusual daylight schedule and extreme cold. Though it is the largest state in area, it is nearly the least populated state at 735,720 people. That means it only makes up 0.22% of the entire US population! To give you more detail, the area of Alaska is 663,267 square miles, and the next largest state is \u003ca href='/states/texas-population/' target='_blank'\u003eTexas\u003c/a\u003e, at 268,581 square miles. The only area in the US less populated than Alaska is the District of \u003ca href='/us-cities/columbia-population/' target='_blank'\u003eColumbia\u003c/a\u003e, with the difference being less than 25,000 people! The largest city in Alaska, \u003ca href='/us-cities/anchorage-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAnchorage\u003c/a\u003e, houses over 40% of the total Alaskan population.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state of Alaska is one of 11 that have seen a decline in its growth in its 2019 population, though its overall growth since the 2010 census indicates an increase of approximately 3.06% from 713,906 people. The drop is measured to be 0.23%, bringing the population down from 737, 438 in 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesarizona-population-target_blankarizonaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/arizona-population/' target='_blank'\u003eArizona\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe latest census estimates the population of Arizona to be around 7,275,070 people in 2019, indicating a growth rate of about 1.44% from the 2018 population of 7,171,646 people. Arizona has seen significant growth since the 2010 census, with figures demonstrating a 13.54% growth rate. This figure makes Arizona the fourth fastest growing state of 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBetween July 2017 and July 2018, Maricopa County added over 81,000 people, equal to more than 200 people per day. Home to cities including \u003ca href='/us-cities/phoenix-population/' target='_blank'\u003ePhoenix\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/mesa-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMesa\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/chandler-population/' target='_blank'\u003eChandler\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/scottsdale-population/' target='_blank'\u003eScottsdale\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/tempe-population/' target='_blank'\u003eTempe\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/glendale-population/' target='_blank'\u003eGlendale\u003c/a\u003e, and many more, Maricopa County was the fourth most populated county in the US and attracted more net migration than any other county in the US. Despite this growth, Arizona still has a below-average population density of 64 people per square mile. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesarkansas-population-target_blankarkansasa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/arkansas-population/' target='_blank'\u003eArkansas\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eArkansas, with a name derived from the Siouan Quapaw Indians, is a landlocked state with diverse geography spanning the mountainous regions of the Ozarks to the forests of the Arkansas Timberlands, to the lowlands of the \u003ca href='/states/mississippi-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMississippi\u003c/a\u003e River and the Arkansas Delta.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBased on the 2010 census, Arkansas has grown 3.57% in population from 2.9 million people to 3,013,825 in 2018 and 3,026,412 people in 2019. The population density is below average at 58 people per square mile, making Arkansas the 34th most populated state in the country. \u003ca href='/us-cities/little-rock-population/' target='_blank'\u003eLittle Rock\u003c/a\u003e serves as the stateâs capital and is the stateâs largest city in terms of population, with almost 200,000 residents. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatescalifornia-population-target_blankcaliforniaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/california-population/' target='_blank'\u003eCalifornia\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCalifornia is the most populated state in the US, boasting a population of 39,747,267 people and making up almost 12% of the entire nationâs population. Since the 2010 census, California has experienced a 6.5% growth rate. The Golden State has an extremely dense population for its size and is ranked the 13th highest population dense state, with 255 people per square mile. The Greater \u003ca href='/us-cities/los-angeles-population/' target='_blank'\u003eLos Angeles\u003c/a\u003e Area and the \u003ca href='/us-cities/san-francisco-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSan Francisco\u003c/a\u003e Bay Area are the nationâs 2nd and 5th most populated urban areas respectively, with 18.7 million and 9.7 million residents. Los Angeles is Californiaâs most heavily populated city and the United Statesâ second most populated city after \u003ca href='/us-cities/new-york-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew York City\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state of California has an economy larger than that of any other state and is the second-largest sub-national economy in the world after \u003ca href='/world-cities/sao-paulo-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSao Paulo\u003c/a\u003e in \u003ca href='/countries/brazil-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBrazil\u003c/a\u003e. California is bordered by \u003ca href='/states/oregon-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOregon\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/states/nevada-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNevada\u003c/a\u003e, Arizona, and Baja California and is on the Western coast of the US, overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatescolorado-population-target_blankcoloradoa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/colorado-population/' target='_blank'\u003eColorado\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated at the heart of the Rocky Mountains, the Centennial State has seen considerable growth since the 2010 census numbers. Its 2018 population grew by 14.31% to 5,695,564 people from 5,048,281 in 2010. The growth trend continues, as 2019 saw another 1.32% increase in the population to over 5.7 million. This current trend is even threatening to cause housing shortages and increased traffic! \nDespite this growth, Colorado still has a below average population density even though the state itself is the eighth largest state in the USA. The harsh terrain and climate as well as the vast Rocky Mountain range are most likely the rationale for this figure.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesconnecticut-population-target_blankconnecticuta\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/connecticut-population/' target='_blank'\u003eConnecticut\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSituated along the Eastern seaboard, Connecticut is one of the six states that comprise the American â\u003ca href='/regions/new-england-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew England\u003c/a\u003e.â This state is a rare case that has experienced consistent decreases in population since the 2010 census. There are only three other cases like this: \u003ca href='/states/illinois-population/' target='_blank'\u003eIllinois\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/states/west-virginia-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWest Virginia\u003c/a\u003e, and the territory of \u003ca href='/countries/puerto-rico-population/' target='_blank'\u003ePuerto Rico\u003c/a\u003e. \nConnecticutâs decrease in growth rate has been gradual, though the population has shrunk from 3,579,125 in 2010 to 3,567,871 in 2019. The state does have an extremely high population density for its size, however; its 737 people per square mile are far above the average 87 per square mile.  This figure is surprising considering the state is ranked 48th out of 50 for smallest area. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesdelaware-population-target_blankdelawarea\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/delaware-population/' target='_blank'\u003eDelaware\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDelaware, the smallest state second only to \u003ca href='/states/rhode-island-population/' target='_blank'\u003eRhode Island\u003c/a\u003e, is home to less than one million individuals. According to the 2018 census, Delawareâs population increased from 899,595 in 2010 to 967,171 in 2018, then to 975,033 based on the 2019 census. Though Delaware is small, its population density is far above the 87 people per square mile; in this little state, there are 500 people every square mile. There are only 1,982 square miles throughout the entire state. Although Dover is the capital, the largest city is \u003ca href='/us-cities/wilmington-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWilmington\u003c/a\u003e. \nAlaska and Delaware are comparable in their population size: 0.22% and 0.29% of the U.S. respectively, though their population densities and the size of the states are wildly different.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"the-district-of-columbia\"\u003eThe District of Columbia\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe District of Columbia, or informally known as \u003ca href='/states/washington-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWashington\u003c/a\u003e, D.C., is the capital of the United States. The word âDistrictâ refers to the area created that is not technically a state but is a federal designation. For statistical purposes, the census bureau treats the District of Columbia as a state-equivalent. This area is unique in that commuters from surrounding \u003ca href='/states/maryland-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMaryland\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href='/states/virginia-population/' target='_blank'\u003eVirginia\u003c/a\u003e suburbs raise the cityâs daytime population to more than one million during the workweek, though the actual residential population according to the 2019 census is 711,571. This number shows small growth of 1.3% from the 2018 population of 702,455. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWashington, D.C., has the highest population density in the country of 11,665 people per square mile based on its very small area. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesflorida-population-target_blankfloridaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/florida-population/' target='_blank'\u003eFlorida\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFlorida is the third most populous state in the nation, with 21,646,155 people according to the 2019 census. This figure indicates over 15% growth since the 2010 census estimate of 18,845,785 people. Floridaâs many beaches and warm climate make it the state a trendy spot for vacations and those who want to live in that matter all year long. The Sunshine State is so loved that the census projections for 2020 place the Floridian population at over 22 million. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href='/us-cities/jacksonville-population/' target='_blank'\u003eJacksonville\u003c/a\u003e alone has a population of over 900,000 people, which is more than the populations of \u003ca href='/states/wyoming-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWyoming\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/states/north-dakota-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNorth Dakota\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/states/south-dakota-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSouth Dakota\u003c/a\u003e, Alaska, \u003ca href='/states/vermont-population/' target='_blank'\u003eVermont\u003c/a\u003e, and the District of Columbia. \u003ca href='/us-cities/tallahassee-population/' target='_blank'\u003eTallahassee\u003c/a\u003e, the state capital, has a population of almost 200,000 people. The population density in the state of Florida, which is 404 people per square mile, is over 4.5 times the national average.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefcountriesgeorgia-population-target_blankgeorgiaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/countries/georgia-population/' target='_blank'\u003eGeorgia\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href='/states/georgia-population/' target='_blank'\u003eGeorgia\u003c/a\u003e is the largest state east of the Mississippi River. It is the eighth-most populated state in the US with a current estimate of 10.63 million residents, surpassing \u003ca href='/states/michigan-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMichigan\u003c/a\u003eâs rank as number eight and representing approximately 3.2% of the American populace. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated in the southeastern corner of the North American continent, Georgia is the 21st largest state in total size (by land area). Its population density is above average at around 185 people per square mile, with the average being around 87. The most populated city in Georgia is \u003ca href='/us-cities/atlanta-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAtlanta\u003c/a\u003e. Its most populated county is Fulton County with over one million residents, making it almost twice the population of Wyoming. The state of Georgia is divided into 159 counties in total; that amount is almost more than any other state except for Texas, which has 254 counties. Georgiaâs least populated county is Taliferro County, with only 1608 people living in the entire 195 square miles. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstateshawaii-population-target_blankhawaiia\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/hawaii-population/' target='_blank'\u003eHawaii\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHawaiiâs population is currently estimated at around 1,416,589, making it the 41st most populated state in the US. This estimate actually represents a 0.27% decrease from the 2018 estimate of 1,420,491. There are eight major islands in Hawaii: \u003ca href='/regions/oahu-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOahu\u003c/a\u003e, Hawaii, \u003ca href='/regions/maui-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMaui\u003c/a\u003e, Molokai, Lanai, Niihau, and Kahoolawe. All are populated except for the last. \u003ca href='/us-cities/honolulu-population/' target='_blank'\u003eHonolulu\u003c/a\u003e is the largest city and county in Hawaii, claiming nearly 350,399 people of Oahu on its own. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHawaii is also home to the smallest county in the US: Kalawao County. Kalawao County has a landmass of a mere 13.21 square miles and is considered the smallest administrative unit in the United States that can be considered a county. It has a population of 88! Though Hawaii is small, it is a beautiful and desirable land, which accounts for its high population density: 221 people per square mile across its 10,931 square miles.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesidaho-population-target_blankidahoa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/idaho-population/' target='_blank'\u003eIdaho\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIdaho is one of the largest states in the US, though its population does not match its landmass. With a population density of only 22 people per square mile for all 82,747 square miles of it, Idaho is only home to approximately 1.79 million US residents. Only six other states in the US have a lower population density than this: Alaska, Wyoming, \u003ca href='/states/montana-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMontana\u003c/a\u003e, North and South Dakota, and \u003ca href='/states/new-mexico-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew Mexico\u003c/a\u003e. The current population also reflects growth from 2018 of about 2.05%, from 1.75 million. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIdahoâs sparse population can be attributed to the Rocky Mountains and expansive lakes, as well as Hellâs Canyon, which is deeper than the Grand Canyon at 7,900 feet. The most populated city in Idaho is the capital city, \u003ca href='/us-cities/boise-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBoise\u003c/a\u003e, at around 218,281 people. The least populated city in Idaho, Warm River, has a staggering population of three.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"illinois\"\u003eIllinois\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Illinois population is estimated to be about 12,700,381 people as of 2019, indicating a negative growth rate of 0.32% from 2018âs estimate of 12,741,080. Surprisingly, Illinois is one of the four states that have shown a decrease from the 2010 consensus and the 2018 consensus. This state saw immense growth throughout the 19th century, but despite its current decrease in population, Illinois remains the sixth most populated state in the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe total area of Illinois is over 57,900 square miles with a population density of 230 people per square mile, though most of the population is heavily concentrated in the northeastern area of the state, in the metropolitan area of \u003ca href='/us-cities/chicago-population/' target='_blank'\u003eChicago\u003c/a\u003e. Chicagoâs population is approximately 2.72 million people, which is close to the size of the entire state of \u003ca href='/states/kansas-population/' target='_blank'\u003eKansas\u003c/a\u003e. The smallest county in Illinois, Hardin County, is home to 3,910 people. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesindiana-population-target_blankindianaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/indiana-population/' target='_blank'\u003eIndiana\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIndiana, the Hoosier state, known for its rustic individualism, shares its northern border with Michigan, eastern border with \u003ca href='/states/ohio-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOhio\u003c/a\u003e, the southern and southeastern border with \u003ca href='/states/kentucky-population/' target='_blank'\u003eKentucky\u003c/a\u003e, and western border with Illinois. It is estimated to have a population of about 6,718,616, demonstrating a growth rate of around 0.4% from the 2018 estimate and making up just over 2% of the U.S. population as a whole. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state of Indiana covers 36,418 square miles, making it the 38th largest state by land area; however, its population makes it the 16th most densely populated state in the country, with a population density of 181 people per square mile. The largest city in Indiana is its capital, \u003ca href='/us-cities/indianapolis-population/' target='_blank'\u003eIndianapolis\u003c/a\u003e, with over 863,700 residents, making it more populated than North Dakota on its own. Indianaâs smallest city is Liberty, with a population of only 2,061 residents as of 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesiowa-population-target_blankiowaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/iowa-population/' target='_blank'\u003eIowa\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated in the Midwestern United States, Iowa shares its borders with \u003ca href='/states/wisconsin-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWisconsin\u003c/a\u003e, Illinois, \u003ca href='/states/missouri-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMissouri\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/states/nebraska-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNebraska\u003c/a\u003e, South Dakota, and \u003ca href='/states/minnesota-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMinnesota\u003c/a\u003e. The state has 99 counties and is the 31st most populated state in the U.S, though it is the 23rd largest state by landmass.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIowaâs 2010 census estimated a population of 3,050,767, while the most recent estimates indicate a growth rate of about 3.84% with a current population of 3,167,997. Iowaâs population is sparse, with a population density below average: 57 people per square mile as opposed to the average of 87 people per square mile. The low population density can be ascribed to the large farmland areas in the state. Because the stateâs economy is mainly agriculture-based, Iowaâs farmlands are in high demand.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state capital, \u003ca href='/us-cities/des-moines-population/' target='_blank'\u003eDes Moines\u003c/a\u003e, is the most populated city in the state, with a population over 217,400 people, and was once designated as the Wealthiest City in America. Urbana, Iowa, however, is the smallest city in the state and houses less than 1,500 residents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"kansas\"\u003eKansas\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated nearly in the center of the United States, Kansas is estimated to have a population of approximately 2.9 million people. This number shows a slight growth rate of about 1.8% from the 2010 estimated population of 2.85 million, making it the 36th most populated state. In terms of landmass, however, Kansas is the 13th largest state, covering over 81,800 square miles. Considering this population and landmass, Kansasâs population density of nearly half the nationâs average should not come as a surprise. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state actually has over 6,000 ghost towns due to the migration from the countryside to the cities, also known as rural flight. The metropolitan cities, however, are quickly growing. \u003ca href='/us-cities/wichita-population/' target='_blank'\u003eWichita\u003c/a\u003e, for example, boasts a population of almost 400,000 residents and is home to the statesâ largest airport: Wichita Dwight D. Eisenhower National Airport. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"kentucky\"\u003eKentucky\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eKentucky, which was previously a part of Virginia, became its own territory and has now grown and developed to become the 26th most populated state in the U.S. with a population of 4,484,047 people. This number represents an approximate growth of 3.12% from the 2010 census estimated population.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlso known as the Bluegrass State, Kentucky is the 36th largest state in area, covering 39,728 square miles. The population density of 114 people per square mile indicates an above-average density that is surprisingly equal across rural and urban areas, though rural areas experience higher levels of poverty throughout the state. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe counties in Kentucky show an interesting mix of growth and decline, though the state shows an overall growth rate in terms of population. The largest county, Jefferson County, shows a growth rate of 3.84%, which is close to the stateâs overall growth rate from 2010 of 3.12%. Scott County showed the most substantial growth rate of 18.51% with a population size of 56,000. However, the county with the most significant decline was Martin County with a decrease of 12.31%, though its population is only 11,323 and not likely to profoundly impact the overall state population.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstateslouisiana-population-target_blanklouisianaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/louisiana-population/' target='_blank'\u003eLouisiana\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSituated on the Gulf of \u003ca href='/countries/mexico-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMexico\u003c/a\u003e, in the Mississippi River Delta, Louisiana is home to approximately 4,652,581 people as of 2019, spread across 64 parishes. It is the 25th largest state in the United States in terms of population. Despite the capital being \u003ca href='/us-cities/baton-rouge-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBaton Rouge\u003c/a\u003e, the city of \u003ca href='/us-cities/new-orleans-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew Orleans\u003c/a\u003e is the largest regarding both population and area size.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough the population rate for the state of Louisiana has increased by 2.38% since the nationwide census in 2010 from a population of approximately 4,544,532 to 4,659,978 in 2018, the growth did decrease slightly in 2019 by 0.159%. These current calculations equate to 108 people per square mile, which is higher than the US average of 87 people per square mile. However, only 11 out of the 52 regions, counting DC and the territory of \u003ca href='/states/puerto-rico-population/' target='_blank'\u003ePuerto Rico\u003c/a\u003e, decreased in population from 2018 to 2019, including Louisiana.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesmaine-population-target_blankmainea\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/maine-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMaine\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSitting at the most northeastern tip of the U.S., Maine, or the Pine Tree State, is one of the top ten least populated states in the U.S., though it has shown slight growth over the last ten years. The population of Maine is estimated to be 1,342,097 people, up about 1.09% from the 2010 census estimate. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIts natural landscape of mountains and a rocky coastline can easily explain the low population density of almost half the nationâs average: Maineâs 44 people per square mile to the average of 87 people. This figure does make it the least densely populated state in New England, however.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOver half of the stateâs population resides in the \u003ca href='/us-cities/portland-population/' target='_blank'\u003ePortland\u003c/a\u003e metropolitan area, accounting for nearly 70,000 residents. The smallest city, Eastport, is actually the easternmost city in the United States. It has just over 1,200 residents and consists almost entirely of islands connected by causeways.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"maryland\"\u003eMaryland\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMaryland may be one of the smallest states in the country, but it is certainly no small matter. It may not have the size, but it makes up for it in population size and density. With an estimated 6.06 million people, Maryland is the 19th most populated state in the U.S. over a mere 9,774 square miles. This figure accounts for a population density of 625 people per square mile â over seven times the national average! This state is the 7th densest population distribution in the U.S. The tiny stateâs population hasnât stopped growing, either: population projections show an estimate of 6.3 million by 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe state is divided into 23 counties, 16 of which border tidal water. The most populated county is Montgomery Country, with over a million people residing and a growth rate of 7.81% since 2010. The entire county, for comparison, has the same population as the whole state of Rhode Island. Rhode Island has about one-sixth of the people as Maryland but is only about one-tenth of its size in landmass. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesmassachusetts-population-target_blankmassachusettsa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/massachusetts-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMassachusetts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite being the 6th smallest state in the country in size, Massachusetts is one of the most populated states in the U.S. Its population is estimated to be around 6.94 million, up from the 6.54 million estimate from the 2010 census.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe tiny stateâs population does a great job of covering every available inch of its 7,840 square miles of land, as its population density of 890 people per square mile is over 10 times the national average! Massachusetts alone makes up for about 2.09% of the U.S. population, making it the most populous of the New England states and the fastest growing one as well.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMassachusetts classifies its municipalities as cities or towns, and with this structure, the smallest town in the state is Gosnold in Dukes County with a population of only 75 people. \u003ca href='/us-cities/boston-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBoston\u003c/a\u003e, the capital, is fittingly the most populated city with an estimated population of 694,784.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"michigan\"\u003eMichigan\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSurrounded by the Great Lakes, Michigan is a Midwestern state and the only U.S. state to consist of two peninsulas. As of 2019, this state had an estimated population of 10.02 million people and accounted for about 3% of the U.S. population, showing a population growth rate of approximately 1.45% from 2010âs figure of 9,877,535.\nMichiganâs population is somewhat dense, with an average of 177 people per square mile, making it the 20th most densely populated state.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe largest city in Michigan is \u003ca href='/us-cities/detroit-population/' target='_blank'\u003eDetroit\u003c/a\u003e, the Motor City, with a population of around 662,000 people. Unfortunately, due to a failing automobile-based economy, Detroit has been experiencing urban decay at an exponential rate. Many of the residents leaving the city do not actually leave the state; they move to the suburbs, though the figures do undeniably show some residents leaving the state altogether.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"minnesota\"\u003eMinnesota\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated in the northern Midwest of the United States, Minnesotaâs population is estimated to be around 5,655,925 in 2019. The last confirmed population numbers were in 2010âs census, with a population of 5,310,843, indicating a population growth of 6.5%. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe stateâs population density is surprisingly below average at 71 people per square mile as opposed to the average of 87, though that may be attributed to the states large surface area: 79,610 square miles. Minnesotaâs geography also contributes to a lower population density than average, considering the large bodies of water and mountainous regions across its landscape. About 60% of the population resides within the \u003ca href='/us-cities/minneapolis-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMinneapolis\u003c/a\u003e-St. Paul metropolitan area, with the remaining 40% dispersed across the rest of the counties and rural areas of the state. The least populated city in Minnesota is Rush City, with a population of only 3,186 residents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"mississippi\"\u003eMississippi\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLocated in the southeastern region of the United States, Mississippi is the 35th most populated state with 2,987,895 people. That estimate shows an approximate growth of 0.58% since 2010. Mississippiâs population density of 64 people per square mile is below the national average of 87, as the state residents tend to be widely spread and live in mostly rural areas. The state is bordered by \u003ca href='/states/tennessee-population/' target='_blank'\u003eTennessee\u003c/a\u003e, Alabama, Louisiana, Arkansas, and the Gulf of Mexico.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href='/us-cities/jackson-population/' target='_blank'\u003eJackson\u003c/a\u003e, the state capital, is the only city in Mississippi with a population above 100,000, and the most populated county in the state has been decreasing in size since 2010. Areas with populations of up to 300 are classified as villages, and Mississippi has one named Satartia with only 55 inhabitants. The main reason the state is losing population, though there is not a discernible growth rate decrease, is due to the attractiveness of job markets elsewhere.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"missouri\"\u003eMissouri\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe landlocked state of Missouri is bordered by eight other states: Iowa, Illinois, Kentucky, Tennessee, Arkansas, \u003ca href='/states/oklahoma-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOklahoma\u003c/a\u003e, Kansas, and Nebraska. It covers 68,886 square miles and has an estimated population of 6,147,861 people, providing an approximate population density near the national average of 87 people per square mile. Missouri has experienced a 2.53% growth rate in population since the 2010 census estimate and is projected to reach 6.8 million in 2030.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMissouriâs current population estimate ranks it as the 18th most populated state in the country, though the population is unevenly spread. The large urban areas have a population density that can reach over 5,000 people per square mile! Missouri does also have a higher rural population than average, with approximately a third of its inhabitants living in rural areas. \u003ca href='/us-cities/kansas-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eKansas City\u003c/a\u003e, Missouriâs largest city, is the sixth-largest city in the Midwest and has an estimated population of about 501,094. The state has seven counties under 5,000 residents: Worth County, Mercer County, Knox County, and Holt County. They have all seen decreases in population since 2010, with Holt County seeing the most dramatic decline at -10.4%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"montana\"\u003eMontana\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMontana, one of the âBig Sky Countryâ states, is one of the countyâs top ten least populated states, with an approximate population of 1,074,532. It has experienced a significant growth rate since the 2010 census of 8.46%, though it remains sparsely populated. Its population density is the third smallest in the country, at a shocking three people per square mile. This low population density can be attributed to its geography, which is largely unsuitable to development.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMontana is the only US state to share borders with three Canadian provinces: Alberta, British Columbia, and Saskatchewan. Counties with 6 or fewer people per square mile are designated as frontier counties, and forty-six of Montanaâs fifty-six counties fall into this category.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThere are a few large urban areas in the state, and they seem to be growing quickly, while the rural areas are slowly becoming less populated. This trend is a common trend in many states. The largest city in Montana is \u003ca href='/us-cities/billings-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBillings\u003c/a\u003e, home to 110,668 residents. The smallest city, which could be technically classified as a village, is Ismay, with 21 people in residence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"nebraska\"\u003eNebraska\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNebraska is the fifteenth largest state by land area and the 38th most populated state in the country. It covers 76,872 square miles and is home to 1.94 million residents, indicating a growth rate of around 6.09% since the 2010 census. 89% of Nebraskaâs cities have less than 3,000 people, which is similar to five other Midwestern states, but many of Nebraskaâs towns have fewer than 1,000 residents. Only one city in the state has a population of over 300,000: \u003ca href='/us-cities/omaha-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOmaha\u003c/a\u003e. Its population is estimated at 452,061, which is nearly twice that of the stateâs capital, \u003ca href='/us-cities/lincoln-population/' target='_blank'\u003eLincoln\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe stateâs average population density is estimated to be around 25 people per square mile, which is far below the nationâs average of 87. Nebraskaâs counties continue to report declining numbers as the more urban areas experience growth. For example, Cortland, Nebraskaâs smallest city in terms of population, only has 466 residents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"nevada\"\u003eNevada\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe landlocked state of Nevada covers 109,826 square miles of land area, making it the seventh-largest state in the country. This state is very sparsely filled; there are only eight states less densely populated than Nevada: Alaska, Wyoming, Montana, North and South Dakota, New Mexico, Idaho, and Nebraska.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNevadaâs current population estimate is 3,087,025, indicating a growth of 14.23% from 2010âs census numbers. A small number of the population lives in rural areas, and the rural culture of Nevada is incredibly different from that of the metropolitan areas such as \u003ca href='/us-cities/reno-population/' target='_blank'\u003eReno\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href='/us-cities/las-vegas-population/' target='_blank'\u003eLas Vegas\u003c/a\u003e. These metropolitan areas tend to be the most populated in Nevada.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNevadaâs capital, \u003ca href='/us-cities/carson-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eCarson City\u003c/a\u003e, with a population of 54,521, is classified as an independent city and does not belong to any of the stateâs seventeen counties. The largest city in Nevada is Las Vegas, with a population of 664,304 people. Las Vegas is the 28th most populated city in the United States and is famous for its hotels, casinos, shopping centers, and fine dining.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesnew-hampshire-population-target_blanknew-hampshirea\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/new-hampshire-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew Hampshire\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNew Hampshire is one of the six New England states in the northeastern United States. It is bordered by Massachusetts, Vermont, Maine, and the Canadian province, Quebec. It is also the seventh smallest state by landmass and the tenth least populated state. New Hampshire was one of the original 13 states, which has assisted in its historical tourism to a certain extent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough there only six states smaller than New Hampshire in size, its population density more than makes up for it with an average of 152 people per square mile. The estimated population of New Hampshire is 1.36 million, with a 3.58% growth rate from the 2010 estimate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe largest city in the state is \u003ca href='/world-cities/manchester-population/' target='_blank'\u003eManchester\u003c/a\u003e, which is also the largest city in northern New England, with a population of 111,826. The smallest city in New Hampshire is Franklin, with 8,492, though many cities have approximately 10,000 residents in the area.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesnew-jersey-population-target_blanknew-jerseya\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/new-jersey-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew Jersey\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNew \u003ca href='/countries/jersey-population/' target='_blank'\u003eJersey\u003c/a\u003e is one of the original thirteen colonies. The only states smaller than New Jersey are Connecticut, Delaware, Rhode Island, and Hawaii in terms of landmass. New Jersey is bordered to the south by the Atlantic Ocean and is situated on the northeastern edge of the United States. Its estimated population in 2019 is 8,922,547, up 1.4% from 8,799,624 in 2010.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNew Jerseyâs territory is highly utilized, with an incredibly high population density of 1213 people per square mile, making it the most densely populated state in the United States. The only area more densely populated in the country is the District of Columbia, which is not technically a state. Every county in New Jersey is considered urban by the Census Bureau.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite the stateâs high population density, there are only four cities with a population above 100,000: \u003ca href='/us-cities/newark-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNewark\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/jersey-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eJersey City\u003c/a\u003e, Paterson, and Elizabeth. Most of New Jerseyâs population lives in counties near \u003ca href='/states/new-york-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNew York\u003c/a\u003e City, \u003ca href='/us-cities/philadelphia-population/' target='_blank'\u003ePhiladelphia\u003c/a\u003e, and the Jersey Shore.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"new-mexico\"\u003eNew Mexico\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNew Mexicoâs growth rate is 0.64% annually, ranking it 30th in the country. The 2010 nationwide census estimated New Mexicoâs population to be approximately 2,059,179, which was the first time the people had exceeded two million. The estimate represented an impressive 14.5% increase in the estimated population from a decade earlier.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNew Mexico is the fifth-largest state by land area, covering 121,356 square miles. In \n2019, the population was estimated to be 2,096,034, which means the population is very sparsely distributed. New Mexicoâs average population density is only 17 people per square mile, far below the national average of 87 people per square mile. In fact, New Mexico is the sixth most sparsely populated territory in the country. Its mountain ranges, deserts, and abundant forests make for difficult residential terrain. Most of the stateâs residents are located in Bernalillo County. Despite being the second smallest county in the state in terms of area, Bernalillo houses more than a third of the stateâs population. The smallest town in New Mexico only has 31 people living there!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"new-a-hrefworld-citiesyork-population-target_blankyorka\"\u003eNew \u003ca href='/world-cities/york-population/' target='_blank'\u003eYork\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eKnown as the Empire State, New York is among the most populated states in the country, with a population of 19,491,339. It is actually the most populated state on the East Coast and the fourth most populated state in the country. Out of a community of nearly 20 million, almost half of them reside in New York City, making it roughly equal to the entire population of New Jersey. New York City, the nationâs most populated city, is actually over 33 times larger than the second-largest city in New York, \u003ca href='/us-cities/buffalo-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBuffalo\u003c/a\u003e. \u003ca href='/us-cities/albany-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAlbany\u003c/a\u003e, the state capital, has a population of 98,469 people, making it the sixth most populated city in the state.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite its massive population, New York has actually experienced a decrease in its growth rate since 2018: its population decreased by 0.26% from 19,542,209 in 2018 to 19,491,339 in 2019. Regardless of the decline in growth, New York still has a shocking average of 414 people per square mile, far above the national population density of 87! \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesnorth-carolina-population-target_blanknorth-carolinaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/north-carolina-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNorth Carolina\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSituated on the east coast of the United States, North Carolina is the ninth most populated state, with an estimated 10,497,741 people. Its growth rate is approximately 1.13%, ranked 14th in the nation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough North Carolinaâs total landmass places it in the lower middle half of the rankings, its population density is impressive: there is an average of 196 people for every square mile, making North Carolina the 15th most densely populated state in the nation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href='/us-cities/charlotte-population/' target='_blank'\u003eCharlotte\u003c/a\u003e is the largest city in North Carolina with a population of 827,097 residents, making it almost exactly the same population size as South Dakota. North Carolina was one of the original 13 colonies and though the state has historically been considered rural, the past three decades have seen an increase in urbanization, and most areas now are considered urban and suburban.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"north-dakota\"\u003eNorth Dakota\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNorth Dakota, also known as the Peace Garden State, the Roughrider State, and the 701, is the seventeenth-largest state in area, the fifth smallest by population, and the fourth most sparsely populated state. Though its economic development has led to population growth and reduced unemployment, its population is estimated only to be 760,900 people. North Dakota is currently experiencing one of the highest growth rates in the United States, second only to the District of Columbia, and estimates show that the stateâs population will break 800,000 by 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNorth Dakotaâs only city with a population larger than 100,000 is \u003ca href='/us-cities/fargo-population/' target='_blank'\u003eFargo\u003c/a\u003e, where over 15% of the entire stateâs population resides. North Dakota does not designate its areas by population or government structure; it deems all areas as cities. As such, even the areas with populations below 100 inhabitants are considered cities in North Dakota.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"ohio\"\u003eOhio\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite being the 34th largest state, Ohio is the 7th most populated and 10th most densely populated in the country, with an estimated population of 11.72 million people as of 2019. It has one of the lowest growth rates in the country, increasing at a rate of only 0.67%, placing it at 43rd in the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the populationâs growth rate is slow in Ohio, it still is higher than most of the country. Ohioâs population density of 287 people per square mile far exceeds the national average of 87, ranking it 10th in the nation, with a total land area of 44,825 square miles.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eInterestingly, Ohioâs cities vary significantly in terms of growth and population. For example, \u003ca href='/us-cities/columbus-population/' target='_blank'\u003eColumbus\u003c/a\u003e is growing at a rapid rate of nearly 10% every decade, while \u003ca href='/us-cities/cleveland-population/' target='_blank'\u003eCleveland\u003c/a\u003e is losing people at a rate of 23 people every day for almost five decades.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"oklahoma\"\u003eOklahoma\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe estimated population of Oklahoma in 2019 is approximately 3,948,950 residents. The state has a relatively low population density in keeping with its size and population rankings. Oklahoma is the 19th largest state in land area, covering 68,667 square miles, and for every square mile in the state, there is an average of 55 people. This figure makes Oklahoma the 35th most densely populated state in the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOklahoma has nearly 600 incorporated areas, but only four cities have a population that exceeds 100,000 residents. 65% of Oklahoma residents live within the \u003ca href='/us-cities/oklahoma-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOklahoma City\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href='/us-cities/tulsa-population/' target='_blank'\u003eTulsa\u003c/a\u003e metro areas, with both being among the largest cities in the United States. Oklahoma City, the state capital, is the largest city in the state, with a population of 661,614, while Tulsa is the second-largest, with a population of 403,045. In these two cities, the population density exceeds 5,000 people per square mile, though the rest of the state remains mostly under 55 people per square mile.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"oregon\"\u003eOregon\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOregon covers 95,997 square miles of land, making it the 9th largest in the United States, though its population is sparsely distributed over its territory. Despite the large land surface area, the state has an estimated 2019 population of 4.25 million.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eParts of Oregon are ruled by geographical elements that make the area unsuitable for residential development and as a result, the average population density is a mere 44 people per square mile. It is bordered by Delaware, Maryland, West Virginia, Ohio, New York, New Jersey, Lake Erie, and \u003ca href='/us-cities/ontario-population/' target='_blank'\u003eOntario\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePennsylvaniaâs current growth rate is just 0.24%, ranking 42nd in the nation. The 2019 estimated population in the state is approximately 12.81 million residents, making it the sixth most populated state in the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough Pennsylvania has a small land surface area, its population density is relatively high, as most of the Eastern states. It is currently the ninth most densely populated state in the country, with a density of 286 people per square mile. A majority of the stateâs population is located in and around Philadelphia, as the city has a population of 1.56 million residents. Thatâs a larger population than the entire state of Hawaii! \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"puerto-rico\"\u003ePuerto Rico\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePuerto Rico, Spanish for ârich portâ and officially the âCommonwealth of Puerto Rico,â is an unincorporated territory of the United States located in the northeast \u003ca href='/continents/caribbean-population/' target='_blank'\u003eCaribbean\u003c/a\u003e Sea, approximately 1000 miles southeast of \u003ca href='/us-cities/miami-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMiami\u003c/a\u003e, Florida.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf Puerto Rico were a full state in the United States, it would be the 29th largest state, ranked between Oklahoma and Connecticut. The last official census results from 2010 indicated that Puerto Ricoâs population was approximately 3.73 million residents. The latest census estimates point to a decrease in the overall population size from the 2010 census, as well as the population size from 2018 to 2019. The reduction from 2018 to 2019 is a significant decline, measured at 2.55%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe largest city in Puerto Rico is the islandâs capital, \u003ca href='/world-cities/san-juan-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSan Juan\u003c/a\u003e. Its population is estimated to be approximately 395,326, making it the 46th largest city in the United States. Puerto Rico is one of the most densely populated areas in the country, with an average of 900 people per square mile.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"rhode-island\"\u003eRhode Island\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eRhode Island is the smallest state in the country in terms of surface area, but its population and population density are no laughing matter. Rhode Island follows New Jersey in terms of population density.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis tiny state only has five counties: \u003ca href='/us-cities/providence-population/' target='_blank'\u003eProvidence\u003c/a\u003e, Kent, Washington, \u003ca href='/world-cities/newport-population/' target='_blank'\u003eNewport\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href='/world-cities/bristol-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBristol\u003c/a\u003e County. Providence Countyâs population is estimated to be 646,084 people, and this county is the only one that has shown growth from 2018 to 2019. The remaining four counties have shown declines in population of 1.31%, 0.73%, 0.76%, and 2.34% respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatessouth-carolina-population-target_blanksouth-carolinaa\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/south-carolina-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSouth Carolina\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSouth Carolina, located on the southeastern tip of the United States, is one of the smallest states in the country. Its current population ranks it as the 47th most populated state in the country, behind Delaware.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe size of the state places it as the 16th largest in terms of land area, though the population is relatively sparse in comparison. That in addition to a lack of employment opportunities has contributed to the exodus to other areas in the country. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis ârural flightâ is becoming common in many Great Plains states, though some areas of South Dakota have been experiencing increases in population. \u003ca href='/us-cities/sioux-falls-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSioux Falls\u003c/a\u003e is one of the fastest-growing cities in the entire country and is the fastest-growing metro area in the state, with a population of 182,574.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"tennessee\"\u003eTennessee\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe 36th largest state in the country is Tennessee, which sits in the southeastern part of the US. Tennesseeâs 2019 population is estimated to be 6,833,793, an increase from the 2010 Census which reported 6.34 million. It was confirmed at the nationwide census in 2010, that Tennessee had a population of 6,346,105, showing an increase of 11.5% from the 2000 census. With a population of 25,145,561, according to the census in 2010, Texas was the second most populous state, and with 2019âs estimated numbers, Texas has reached an all-time high of over 27 million.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTexas is 2nd in terms of populous to California, and in terms of surface area, it is 2nd to Alaska. This state is 268,581 square mile, with only 105.2 people per square mile. \u003ca href='/us-cities/dallas-population/' target='_blank'\u003eDallas\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/houston-population/' target='_blank'\u003eHouston\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href='/us-cities/san-antonio-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSan Antonio\u003c/a\u003e are three of the largest cities in Texas, each with over one million people. \u003ca href='/us-cities/el-paso-population/' target='_blank'\u003eEl Paso\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href='/us-cities/fort-worth-population/' target='_blank'\u003eFort Worth\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href='/us-cities/austin-population/' target='_blank'\u003eAustin\u003c/a\u003e -- the state capital, each have populations over 500,000. Harris County has a whopping 4,652,980 people while Dallas County is close behind with 2,618,148 residents. These are the largest counties in Texas; both counties have current growth rates of more than 10%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"a-hrefstatesutah-population-target_blankutaha\"\u003e\u003ca href='/states/utah-population/' target='_blank'\u003eUtah\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eUtahâs estimated population for 2019 is 3.22 million, a significant increase from the 2.76 million residents that were counted in 2010. In 2010, the last nationwide census showed that Utahâs population was 2,763,885, a 20% increase from the numbers recorded in the 2000 census. Utahâs current growth rate of 1.6%, makes it the 4th fastest-growing state in the country, however, its 2019 estimated population makes it the 34th most populous state. Most of Utahâs residents live in the \u003ca href='/us-cities/salt-lake-city-population/' target='_blank'\u003eSalt Lake City\u003c/a\u003e area, (80%), leaving many areas uninhabited. Though in terms of landmass, Utah is the 13th largest state, the many uninhabited areas could contribute to its rank of 34th post populous.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eUtahâs surface area is 84,899 square miles, with an average of 33.6 people per square mile, while Salt Lake City has 1,666 people per square mile. With 1.3 million people, Salt Lake City is the largest metropolitan area. Over 2 million of Utahâs residents live in the cities and towns along the Wasatch Front, a metropolitan area running north-south along the Wasatch Mountains. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"vermont\"\u003eVermont\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eVermont is also called the Green Mountain State. By population, it is the 49th largest and the 45th largest by area size. The census of 2015 estimated Vermontâs population to be 626,042; it is on this estimate that the 2019 population of Vermont is estimated to be 627,180, which is only slightly higher than the 625,741 population in 2010. In the last nationwide census of 2010, Vermontâs confirmed population of 625,741, showed a small increase of 2.8% over the numbers recorded on the 2000 census. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eVermont, however, does make good use of its tiny surface area. For every one of its 9,614 square miles, the average people covering each square mile is 67.9, which makes Vermont the 30th most densely populated state in the country. With Vermontâs population being small, there is no surprise in the absence of major urban areas. Only three of Vermontâs nine incorporated cities have more than 10,000, the largest being \u003ca href='/world-cities/burlington-population/' target='_blank'\u003eBurlington\u003c/a\u003e with over 42,000 residents, followed by South Burlington with 18,791 people. The 5th is Vermontâs capital, \u003ca href='/us-cities/montpelier-population/' target='_blank'\u003eMontpelier\u003c/a\u003e with 7,892 residents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 id=\"virginia\"\u003eVirginia\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe 35th largest state in the union is Virginia. It is located on the central-eastern tip of the country and, with a current growth rate of 1.15%, is ranked 13th in the country. In 2010, the last nationwide census revealed that, for the first time in the state of Virginiaâs history, it had exceeded 8 million in population, Virginiaâs 2019 estimated population of 8.57 million, is a 380,000 increase over that number. The final confirming figure of 8,001,024 in 2010 was a 13% increase over the numbers that were recorded at the 2000 census. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eVirginia has a surface area of 42,775 square miles, with 202.6 people over a square mile, making it 14th in terms of density and 12th in terms of the population thanks to its 8,571,946 residents. Of its 11 Metropolitan Statistical Areas, the most populous include Hampton Roads, Northern Virginia, and \u003ca href='/us-cities/richmond-population/' target='_blank'\u003eRichmond\u003c/a\u003e-Petersburg. This population is distributed unevenly across 50 states. Generally, states that are around the country\u0026#x2019;s border \u0026#x2013; West Coast, East Coast, and southern states \u0026#x2013; are the most populous. States that are more interior, such as those in the Great Plains and Midwest, tend to be less populous. However, there are some exceptions, such as Illinois, which is in the Midwest but has a high population, mainly centered in the \u003ca href=\"/us-cities/chicago-population/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eChicago\u003c/a\u003e area.\u003c/p\u003e","\u003cp\u003eBy far, the most populous state in the United States is California. It has nearly 40 million residents, comprising a whopping 12% of the country\u0026#x2019;s population. If California were a country, it would have the eighth largest economy in the world and the 36th highest population! \u003c/p\u003e","\u003cp\u003eNext in line is Texas, which has about 29 million residents; however, Texas has a growth rate of 1.34% per year, while California\u0026#x2019;s growth rate is less than half of that at 0.48%. Since 2010, the population of Texas has increased by over 15%! After California and Texas comes Florida, with a population of about 21.5 million. It is also growing rapidly, with a growth rate of 1.63% per year. \u003c/p\u003e","\u003cp\u003eOn the East Coast, the most populous state is New \u003ca href=\"/world-cities/york-population/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eYork\u003c/a\u003e, which is the fourth most populous in the country. Out of a population of 20 million, about half of its residents live in \u003ca href=\"/us-cities/new-york-city-population/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eNew York City\u003c/a\u003e. States in \u003ca href=\"/regions/new-england-population/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eNew England\u003c/a\u003e, along the Northeast seaboard, tend to be quite small geographically but with higher populations. Rhode Island is the smallest state by land mass, but it has a higher population than many larger states, including Alaska (the largest state by land mass), Montana, and Wyoming. Montana, though it has a vastly larger land mass than Rhode Island, has 10,000 fewer residents.\u003c/p\u003e","\u003cp\u003eThe smallest state by population is Wyoming, with fewer than 600,000 residents and a negative growth rate of almost 1% per year. Election Results"},{"article":"The 2016 presidential election in the United States resulted in Donald Trump being elected as the 45th President of the United States. \n\nThe United States uses the Electoral College, a process where the people vote to choose their electors, then a meeting of 538 electors takes place to vote for the presidential candidates, and then Congress counts the electoral votes. A majority of 270 electoral votes is required to elect the President.\n\nA stateâs number of electors is identical to the total number of its senators and representatives in Congress. Seven states and Washington D.C. have the minimum of three electors. California has the most electoral votes, with 55, followed by Texas with 38 and New York and Florida is 29 each. \n\nWhen citizens head to the polls on Election Day, they vote for which candidate they want to win, typically either Democratic or Republican, and then whichever party wins the vote in that state will have its electors sent to cast their votes for that candidate. In all states, except Maine and Nebraska, the party that wins the popular vote gets to send all of its electors to vote. Maine and Nebraska apportion two electoral votes to the winner and the rest of the votes are given to the winner in each of the statesâ congressional districts.\n\nIn 2016, the state with the highest percentage of Republican voters was West Virginia, with 68% of voters voting Republican. The most Democratic state in the 2016 election was Washington D.C., which voted over 90% Democratic, followed by Hawaii, which voted 62.22% Democratic.\n\nPresident Donald Trump won the 2016 election with 306 electoral votes over Hillary Clinton, who received 232 electoral votes.\n","data":{"states":[],"customMeta":{"columns":["state",{"header":"Votes
